title: Reductions
content:
# Algorithmic Paradigms

## Reductions

Use known algorithms to solve new problems.

![](image-kk4d4pob.png)

![](image-kk4d8x6i.png)

![](image-kk4el1za.png)


## Divide and Conquer algorithms (and solving recurrences)

Binary search is a DnC, MergeSort and Quicksort are also DnC

![](image-kk4eqbcq.png)

It's hard to prove exactly, if your $n$ isn't a power of 2 or 4 or something. but in those cases, you can usually expand $n$ to a power of 2, and end up with the same asymptotic bound.
![](image-kk4ete4p.png)

![](image-kk4exby6.png)


![](image-kk4f2d1g.png)


![](image-kk4f9uce.png)

The $c+1$ at the end there is the issue.

![](image-kk4fgkah.png)

![](image-kk4fitbh.png)

This is so POG!
